Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuickSort

  • public class QuickSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a quicksort class that is not generic, it has been implemented only to be used with incidents.
    Version:
    2.0 Citation: ArrayList implementation of QuickSort is referencing https://www.withexample.com/quicksort-implementation-example-using-arraylist-java/
    Author:
    Michael Barreiros

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuickSort(java.util.ArrayList<Incidents> inputArray)
      This is the constructor for the quicksort class, it takes an ArrayList of incidents to be sorted

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int partition(int lo, int hi)
      This method does the partitioning that is necessary for quicksort to function
      static void shuffle()
      This method randomly shuffles the incoming array
      static void sortBasicQuick()
      basic quick sort shuffles the array first then calls the other sortBasicQuick function that uses 0 as its lower bound and the size of the array - 1 as its upper bound
      static void sortBasicQuick(int lo, int hi)
      A recursive basic quicksort that partitions an element then performs quicksort on sub-array to the left of the partitioned element and then to the left

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort(java.util.ArrayList<Incidents> inputArray)
        This is the constructor for the quicksort class, it takes an ArrayList of incidents to be sorted
        Parameters:
        inputArray - the array to be sorted

    • Method Detail

      • shuffle

        public static void shuffle()
        This method randomly shuffles the incoming array

      • partition

        public static int partition(int lo,
                            int hi)
        This method does the partitioning that is necessary for quicksort to function
        Parameters:
        lo - the lower bound of the array to be partitioned
        hi - the upper bound of the array to be partitioned
        Returns:
        returns the final location of the incident that was partitioned correctly

      • sortBasicQuick

        public static void sortBasicQuick()
        basic quick sort shuffles the array first then calls the other sortBasicQuick function that uses 0 as its lower bound and the size of the array - 1 as its upper bound

      • sortBasicQuick

        public static void sortBasicQuick(int lo,
                                  int hi)
        A recursive basic quicksort that partitions an element then performs quicksort on sub-array to the left of the partitioned element and then to the left
        Parameters:
        lo - the lower bound of the array to be sorted
        hi - the upper bound of the array to be sorted
